thread.title: Pittsburgh Families Invited to 11 Free and Low-Cost Events November 14-16 - NewsBreak
thread.title_full: Pittsburgh Families Invited to 11 Free and Low-Cost Events November 14-16 - NewsBreak

author: Pennsylvania Updates
title: Pittsburgh Families Invited to 11 Free and Low-Cost Events November 14-16 - NewsBreak
text:
12 hours ago Pittsburgh will host 11 family-friendly events from November 14 to 16, 2025. Most events are free. The schedule includes cultural, educational, and festive activities for all ages.
The weekend starts on Friday, November 14, with Duo’s Treehouse at The Kingsley Center. This bilingual playgroup is for caregivers and children under five. Sessions are in English and Spanish. Pre-registration is required, but the class is free.
Also on Friday, the County Services Resource Fair will take place at the Carnegie Library’s Downtown location from noon to 3 p.m. Organizations such as the Allegheny County Health Department and Department of Human Services will provide information on health, housing, and wellness. The event is free and open to families.
On Friday evening, the Terminal Tree Lighting will be held in the Strip District from 5 to 9 p.m. The Terminal Christmas Tree will be lit at 5:45 p.m. The event includes a holiday market, local vendors, music by DJ Breis Gordan, and food options.
The weekend also features arts and cultural events. Prime Stage Theatre will present “Mr. Edgar A. Poe Presents: Tales of Mystery, Horror & Imagination” at the New Hazlett Theater. There will be four shows, including a sensory-inclusive performance on Saturday afternoon. The I Made It! Holiday Market at The Block Northway on Saturday will have local artists, makers, and food vendors.
Other events include Reading Ready Pittsburgh’s Celebration of Families at B is for Books, a storytime with Pittsburgh Action Against Rape at Penn Hills Library, and a sensory-friendly musical performance, “Jingle Bell Jukebox,” at South Park Theatre. Pittsburgh families have several free and inclusive events to choose from during the November weekend.
Visit here for more details This post includes content assisted by AI tools. Please refer to the source for verification and additional information. Learn more.
